name: Brazilian Banana Bread
author: Fernanda Esteves
summary: In Brazil we call this Banana Cake, but when I baked this for the first time here everyone started calling it Banana Bread. You can add nuts in the dough or on the top if you wish.
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
In a large bowl, mix together margarine and sugar until smooth
Stir in flour and baking powder alternately with the milk
In another bowl, beat egg whites until doubled in volume
Fold beaten whites into the dough
Spread into a greased 9 x 12 inch pan
Slice bananas over the top of the dough
In a small bowl, mix together the 2 tablespoons sugar and the cinnamon; sprinkle over bananas
Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 30 to 35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean
